intro: Ononis natrix subsp. font-queri, commonly known as the Fontqueri's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in inflorescences at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements make it a notable species in ecological studies.
